intro: Thalictrum pyrrha, commonly known as the red avens, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other flowering plants. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Thalictrum pyrrha typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to gardens and ecological restoration projects.
